title: The New AFK punishment system is working very well
body:
Except that it isnt.

Still get about 2 afks per 10 or so games. 

At least we have a system that treats people like children even if they disconnect through no fault of their own...

Honestly, my first reaction to being forced to type in "I agree" was * fuck you* I was more inspired to do as I please out of spite than anything.

replies.body: It's rather frustrating. The new system has been implemented and it feels like I've seen an increased number of afk's to be honest. I'm usually not one to complain but it's gotten out of hand for me recently.

> [{quoted}](name=The Best Godyr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8WqPTA4O,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2014-12-17T03:14:51.988+0000)
>
> It's rather frustrating. The new system has been implemented and it feels like I've seen an increased number of afk's to be honest. I'm usually not one to complain but it's gotten out of hand for me recently.

I think the reason might be a sort of dooms day for afkers? I mean at day one of the new systems release I noticed a lot of people just going with the "screw it I am gonna get banned anyway so why bother!?!" mentality. Perhaps it MIGHT be working its just taking time to clean out the large amount of ragers, trolls, and afkers. I mean lots of people play lol and have back up accounts as well so it takes time to weed them out.

The new afk system is shit. All it does is piss people off who play frequently that have a higher chance to dc at some point but still be penalized the same as someone who plays 1 game a day. If you ever dc more than once prepare ur anus for 5 minutes of waiting.{{champion:6}}
